subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: Taylor Phinney of the United States won the individual pursuit and Morgan Kneisky of France captured the scratch title at the track world championships in Pruszkow, Poland. Phinney outpaced Jack Bobridge of Australia with a time of 4 minutes 17.631 seconds to win his first world title. Bobridge finished almost three seconds back. Phinney, 18, the son of the 1984 Olympic medalists Connie Carpenter-Phinney and Davis Phinney, set an American record of 4:15.16 in qualifying earlier in the day, breaking the record he set at the World Cup last month in Copenhagen.
